verses.kjv: This then was the lot of the tribe of the children of Judah by their families; even to the border of Edom the wilderness of Zin southward was the uttermost part of the south coast.
verses.web: The lot for the tribe of the children of Judah according to their families was to the border of Edom, even to the wilderness of Zin southward, at the uttermost part of the south.
verses.ct: The land assigned by lot to the tribe of Judah, distributed among their clans, stretched south all the way to the border of Edom, reaching the wilderness of Zin at the farthest edge of the southern territory.

verses.kjv: And their south border was from the shore of the salt sea, from the bay that looketh southward:
verses.web: Their south border was from the uttermost part of the Salt Sea, from the bay that looks southward;
verses.ct: Their southern boundary started at the southern tip of the Salt Sea, from the bay that faces south.

verses.kjv: And it went out to the south side to Maalehacrabbim, and passed along to Zin, and ascended up on the south side unto Kadeshbarnea, and passed along to Hezron, and went up to Adar, and fetched a compass to Karkaa:
verses.web: and it went out southward of the ascent of Akrabbim, and passed along to Zin, and went up by the south of Kadesh Barnea, and passed along by Hezron, went up to Addar, and turned toward Karka;
verses.ct: From there it ran south of the Ascent of Akrabbim, continued through Zin, climbed south of Kadesh Barnea, passed by Hezron, went up to Addar, and curved around toward Karkaa.

verses.kjv: From thence it passed toward Azmon, and went out unto the river of Egypt; and the goings out of that coast were at the sea: this shall be your south coast.
verses.web: and it passed along to Azmon, went out at the brook of Egypt; and the border ended at the sea. This shall be your south border.
verses.ct: It then continued to Azmon and followed the brook of Egypt until it reached the Mediterranean Sea. This was their southern boundary.

verses.kjv: And the east border was the salt sea, even unto the end of Jordan. And their border in the north quarter was from the bay of the sea at the uttermost part of Jordan:
verses.web: The east border was the Salt Sea, even to the end of the Jordan. The border of the north quarter was from the bay of the sea at the end of the Jordan.
verses.ct: The eastern boundary was the Salt Sea, running north to where the Jordan River empties into it. The northern boundary began at that same bay where the Jordan meets the sea.

verses.kjv: And the border went up to Bethhogla, and passed along by the north of Betharabah; and the border went up to the stone of Bohan the son of Reuben:
verses.web: The border went up to Beth Hoglah, and passed along by the north of Beth Arabah; and the border went up to the stone of Bohan the son of Reuben.
verses.ct: From there the border went up to Beth Hoglah, passed north of Beth Arabah, and continued up to the Stone of Bohan (named after Bohan son of Reuben).

verses.kjv: And the border went up toward Debir from the valley of Achor, and so northward, looking toward Gilgal, that is before the going up to Adummim, which is on the south side of the river: and the border passed toward the waters of Enshemesh, and the goings out thereof were at Enrogel:
verses.web: The border went up to Debir from the valley of Achor, and so northward, looking toward Gilgal, that faces the ascent of Adummim, which is on the south side of the river. The border passed along to the waters of En Shemesh, and ended at En Rogel.
verses.ct: The border then went up to Debir from the Valley of Achor, turning north toward Gilgal, which faces the Ascent of Adummim on the south side of the ravine. It continued to the springs of En Shemesh and ended at En Rogel.

verses.kjv: And the border went up by the valley of the son of Hinnom unto the south side of the Jebusite; the same is Jerusalem: and the border went up to the top of the mountain that lieth before the valley of Hinnom westward, which is at the end of the valley of the giants northward:
verses.web: The border went up by the valley of the son of Hinnom to the side of the Jebusite (also called Jerusalem) southward; and the border went up to the top of the mountain that lies before the valley of Hinnom westward, which is at the farthest part of the valley of Rephaim northward.
verses.ct: From there the border climbed through the Valley of Ben Hinnom along the southern slope of the Jebusite city — that is, Jerusalem. It then went up to the top of the mountain west of the Hinnom Valley, at the northern end of the Valley of Rephaim.

verses.kjv: And the border was drawn from the top of the hill unto the fountain of the water of Nephtoah, and went out to the cities of mount Ephron; and the border was drawn to Baalah, which is Kirjathjearim:
verses.web: The border extended from the top of the mountain to the spring of the waters of Nephtoah, and went out to the cities of Mount Ephron; and the border extended to Baalah (also called Kiriath Jearim);
verses.ct: From that hilltop the border curved to the spring of Nephtoah, extended to the towns near Mount Ephron, and then turned toward Baalah, also known as Kiriath Jearim.

verses.kjv: And the border compassed from Baalah westward unto mount Seir, and passed along unto the side of mount Jearim, which is Chesalon, on the north side, and went down to Bethshemesh, and passed on to Timnah:
verses.web: and the border turned about from Baalah westward to Mount Seir, and passed along to the side of Mount Jearim (also called Chesalon) on the north, and went down to Beth Shemesh, and passed along by Timnah;
verses.ct: From Baalah the border turned west toward Mount Seir, ran along the northern slope of Mount Jearim (also called Chesalon), descended to Beth Shemesh, and continued past Timnah.

verses.kjv: And the border went out unto the side of Ekron northward: and the border was drawn to Shicron, and passed along to mount Baalah, and went out unto Jabneel; and the goings out of the border were at the sea.
verses.web: and the border went out to the side of Ekron northward; and the border extended to Shikkeron, and passed along to Mount Baalah, and went out at Jabneel; and the goings out of the border were at the sea.
verses.ct: The border then went to the northern side of Ekron, curved toward Shicron, crossed over to Mount Baalah, and reached Jabneel before ending at the Mediterranean Sea.

verses.kjv: And the west border was to the great sea, and the coast thereof. This is the coast of the children of Judah round about according to their families.
verses.web: The west border was to the shore of the great sea. This is the border of the children of Judah according to their families.
verses.ct: The western boundary was the coastline of the Mediterranean Sea. These were the borders surrounding the territory of Judah, distributed among their clans.

verses.kjv: And unto Caleb the son of Jephunneh he gave a part among the children of Judah, according to the commandment of the LORD to Joshua, even the city of Arba the father of Anak, which city is Hebron.
verses.web: He gave to Caleb the son of Jephunneh a portion among the children of Judah, according to the commandment of LORD to Joshua, even Kiriath Arba, named after the father of Anak (also called Hebron).
verses.ct: As the LORD had commanded Joshua, he gave Caleb son of Jephunneh a portion within Judah's territory — specifically Kiriath Arba (named after Arba, the father of Anak), which is now called Hebron.

verses.kjv: And Caleb drove thence the three sons of Anak, Sheshai, and Ahiman, and Talmai, the children of Anak.
verses.web: Caleb drove out the three sons of Anak: Sheshai, and Ahiman, and Talmai, the children of Anak.
verses.ct: Caleb drove out the 3 descendants of Anak who lived there: Sheshai, Ahiman, and Talmai.

verses.kjv: And he went up thence to the inhabitants of Debir: and the name of Debir before was Kirjathsepher.
verses.web: He went up against the inhabitants of Debir: now the name of Debir before was Kiriath Sepher.
verses.ct: From there he marched against the people living in Debir, which was formerly called Kiriath Sepher.

verses.kjv: And Caleb said, He that smiteth Kirjathsepher, and taketh it, to him will I give Achsah my daughter to wife.
verses.web: Caleb said, “He who strikes Kiriath Sepher, and takes it, to him I will give Achsah my daughter as wife.”
verses.ct: Caleb announced, "Whoever attacks Kiriath Sepher and captures it — I'll give him my daughter Achsah as his wife."

verses.kjv: And Othniel the son of Kenaz, the brother of Caleb, took it: and he gave him Achsah his daughter to wife.
verses.web: Othniel the son of Kenaz, the brother of Caleb, took it: and he gave him Achsah his daughter as wife.
verses.ct: Othniel son of Kenaz, Caleb's brother, captured the city. So Caleb gave him his daughter Achsah in marriage.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as she came unto him, that she moved him to ask of her father a field: and she lighted off her ass; and Caleb said unto her, What wouldest thou?
verses.web: When she came, she had him ask her father for a field. She got off her donkey, and Caleb said, “What do you want?”
verses.ct: When Achsah came to Othniel, she urged him to ask her father for a piece of land. She got down from her donkey, and Caleb asked her, "What do you want?"

verses.kjv: Who answered, Give me a blessing; for thou hast given me a south land; give me also springs of water. And he gave her the upper springs, and the nether springs.
verses.web: She said, “Give me a blessing. Because you have set me in the land of the South, give me also springs of water.” So he gave her the upper springs and the lower springs.
verses.ct: She replied, "Give me a blessing. You've given me land in the dry south — please give me springs of water too." So he gave her both the upper springs and the lower springs.

verses.kjv: This is the inheritance of the tribe of the children of Judah according to their families.
verses.web: This is the inheritance of the tribe of the children of Judah according to their families.
verses.ct: This was the inheritance of the tribe of Judah, distributed among their clans.

verses.kjv: And the uttermost cities of the tribe of the children of Judah toward the coast of Edom southward were Kabzeel, and Eder, and Jagur,
verses.web: The farthest cities of the tribe of the children of Judah toward the border of Edom in the South were Kabzeel, Eder, Jagur,
verses.ct: The southernmost cities belonging to the tribe of Judah, near the border of Edom, were Kabzeel, Eder, Jagur,

verses.kjv: And Kinah, and Dimonah, and Adadah,
verses.web: Kinah, Dimonah, Adadah,
verses.ct: Kinah, Dimonah, Adadah,

verses.kjv: And Kedesh, and Hazor, and Ithnan,
verses.web: Kedesh, Hazor, Ithnan,
verses.ct: Kedesh, Hazor, Ithnan,

verses.kjv: Ziph, and Telem, and Bealoth,
verses.web: Ziph, Telem, Bealoth,
verses.ct: Ziph, Telem, Bealoth,

verses.kjv: And Hazor, Hadattah, and Kerioth, and Hezron, which is Hazor,
verses.web: Hazor Hadattah, Kerioth Hezron (also called Hazor),
verses.ct: Hazor Hadattah, Kerioth Hezron (also called Hazor),

verses.kjv: Amam, and Shema, and Moladah,
verses.web: Amam, Shema, Moladah,
verses.ct: Amam, Shema, Moladah,

verses.kjv: And Hazargaddah, and Heshmon, and Bethpalet,
verses.web: Hazar Gaddah, Heshmon, Beth Pelet,
verses.ct: Hazar Gaddah, Heshmon, Beth Palet,

verses.kjv: And Hazarshual, and Beersheba, and Bizjothjah,
verses.web: Hazar Shual, Beersheba, Biziothiah,
verses.ct: Hazar Shual, Beersheba, Bizjothjah,

verses.kjv: Baalah, and Iim, and Azem,
verses.web: Baalah, Iim, Ezem,
verses.ct: Baalah, Iim, Azem,

verses.kjv: And Eltolad, and Chesil, and Hormah,
verses.web: Eltolad, Chesil, Hormah,
verses.ct: Eltolad, Chesil, Hormah,

verses.kjv: And Ziklag, and Madmannah, and Sansannah,
verses.web: Ziklag, Madmannah, Sansannah,
verses.ct: Ziklag, Madmannah, Sansannah,

verses.kjv: And Lebaoth, and Shilhim, and Ain, and Rimmon: all the cities are twenty and nine, with their villages:
verses.web: Lebaoth, Shilhim, Ain, and Rimmon. All the cities are twenty-nine, with their villages.
verses.ct: Lebaoth, Shilhim, Ain, and Rimmon — 29 cities in all, along with their surrounding villages.

verses.kjv: And in the valley, Eshtaol, and Zoreah, and Ashnah,
verses.web: In the lowland, Eshtaol, Zorah, Ashnah,
verses.ct: In the lowlands: Eshtaol, Zoreah, Ashnah,

verses.kjv: And Zanoah, and Engannim, Tappuah, and Enam,
verses.web: Zanoah, En Gannim, Tappuah, Enam,
verses.ct: Zanoah, En Gannim, Tappuah, Enam,

verses.kjv: Jarmuth, and Adullam, Socoh, and Azekah,
verses.web: Jarmuth, Adullam, Socoh, Azekah,
verses.ct: Jarmuth, Adullam, Socoh, Azekah,

verses.kjv: And Sharaim, and Adithaim, and Gederah, and Gederothaim; fourteen cities with their villages:
verses.web: Shaaraim, Adithaim and Gederah (or Gederothaim); fourteen cities with their villages.
verses.ct: Sharaim, Adithaim, Gederah, and Gederothaim — 14 cities along with their surrounding villages.

verses.kjv: Zenan, and Hadashah, and Migdalgad,
verses.web: Zenan, Hadashah, Migdal Gad,
verses.ct: Zenan, Hadashah, Migdal Gad,

verses.kjv: And Dilean, and Mizpeh, and Joktheel,
verses.web: Dilean, Mizpah, Joktheel,
verses.ct: Dilean, Mizpeh, Joktheel,

verses.kjv: Lachish, and Bozkath, and Eglon,
verses.web: Lachish, Bozkath, Eglon,
verses.ct: Lachish, Bozkath, Eglon,

verses.kjv: And Cabbon, and Lahmam, and Kithlish,
verses.web: Cabbon, Lahmam, Chitlish,
verses.ct: Cabbon, Lahmam, Kithlish,

verses.kjv: And Gederoth, Bethdagon, and Naamah, and Makkedah; sixteen cities with their villages:
verses.web: Gederoth, Beth Dagon, Naamah, and Makkedah; sixteen cities with their villages.
verses.ct: Gederoth, Beth Dagon, Naamah, and Makkedah — 16 cities along with their surrounding villages.

verses.kjv: Libnah, and Ether, and Ashan,
verses.web: Libnah, Ether, Ashan,
verses.ct: Libnah, Ether, Ashan,

verses.kjv: And Jiphtah, and Ashnah, and Nezib,
verses.web: Iphtah, Ashnah, Nezib,
verses.ct: Jiphtah, Ashnah, Nezib,

verses.kjv: And Keilah, and Achzib, and Mareshah; nine cities with their villages:
verses.web: Keilah, Achzib, and Mareshah; nine cities with their villages.
verses.ct: Keilah, Achzib, and Mareshah — 9 cities along with their surrounding villages.

verses.kjv: Ekron, with her towns and her villages:
verses.web: Ekron, with its towns and its villages;
verses.ct: Ekron, with its towns and villages;

verses.kjv: From Ekron even unto the sea, all that lay near Ashdod, with their villages:
verses.web: from Ekron even to the sea, all that were by the side of Ashdod, with their villages.
verses.ct: from Ekron westward to the sea, everything near Ashdod along with their villages;

verses.kjv: Ashdod with her towns and her villages, Gaza with her towns and her villages, unto the river of Egypt, and the great sea, and the border thereof:
verses.web: Ashdod, its towns and its villages; Gaza, its towns and its villages; to the brook of Egypt, and the great sea with its coastline.
verses.ct: Ashdod with its towns and villages; Gaza with its towns and villages — all the way to the brook of Egypt and the coastline of the Mediterranean Sea.

verses.kjv: And in the mountains, Shamir, and Jattir, and Socoh,
verses.web: In the hill country, Shamir, Jattir, Socoh,
verses.ct: In the hill country: Shamir, Jattir, Socoh,

verses.kjv: And Dannah, and Kirjathsannah, which is Debir,
verses.web: Dannah, Kiriath Sannah (which is Debir),
verses.ct: Dannah, Kiriath Sannah (also known as Debir),

verses.kjv: And Anab, and Eshtemoh, and Anim,
verses.web: Anab, Eshtemoh, Anim,
verses.ct: Anab, Eshtemoh, Anim,

verses.kjv: And Goshen, and Holon, and Giloh; eleven cities with their villages:
verses.web: Goshen, Holon, and Giloh; eleven cities with their villages.
verses.ct: Goshen, Holon, and Giloh — 11 cities along with their surrounding villages.

verses.kjv: Arab, and Dumah, and Eshean,
verses.web: Arab, Dumah, Eshan,
verses.ct: Arab, Dumah, Eshean,

verses.kjv: And Janum, and Bethtappuah, and Aphekah,
verses.web: Janim, Beth Tappuah, Aphekah,
verses.ct: Janum, Beth Tappuah, Aphekah,

verses.kjv: And Humtah, and Kirjatharba, which is Hebron, and Zior; nine cities with their villages:
verses.web: Humtah, Kiriath Arba (also called Hebron), and Zior; nine cities with their villages.
verses.ct: Humtah, Kiriath Arba (also called Hebron), and Zior — 9 cities along with their surrounding villages.

verses.kjv: Maon, Carmel, and Ziph, and Juttah,
verses.web: Maon, Carmel, Ziph, Jutah,
verses.ct: Maon, Carmel, Ziph, Juttah,

verses.kjv: And Jezreel, and Jokdeam, and Zanoah,
verses.web: Jezreel, Jokdeam, Zanoah,
verses.ct: Jezreel, Jokdeam, Zanoah,

verses.kjv: Cain, Gibeah, and Timnah; ten cities with their villages:
verses.web: Kain, Gibeah, and Timnah; ten cities with their villages.
verses.ct: Cain, Gibeah, and Timnah — 10 cities along with their surrounding villages.

verses.kjv: Halhul, Bethzur, and Gedor,
verses.web: Halhul, Beth Zur, Gedor,
verses.ct: Halhul, Beth Zur, Gedor,

verses.kjv: And Maarath, and Bethanoth, and Eltekon; six cities with their villages:
verses.web: Maarath, Beth Anoth, and Eltekon; six cities with their villages.
verses.ct: Maarath, Beth Anoth, and Eltekon — 6 cities along with their surrounding villages.

verses.kjv: Kirjathbaal, which is Kirjathjearim, and Rabbah; two cities with their villages:
verses.web: Kiriath Baal (also called Kiriath Jearim), and Rabbah; two cities with their villages.
verses.ct: Kiriath Baal (also called Kiriath Jearim) and Rabbah — 2 cities along with their surrounding villages.

verses.kjv: In the wilderness, Betharabah, Middin, and Secacah,
verses.web: In the wilderness, Beth Arabah, Middin, Secacah,
verses.ct: In the wilderness: Beth Arabah, Middin, Secacah,

verses.kjv: And Nibshan, and the city of Salt, and Engedi; six cities with their villages.
verses.web: Nibshan, the City of Salt, and En Gedi; six cities with their villages.
verses.ct: Nibshan, the City of Salt, and En Gedi — 6 cities along with their surrounding villages.

verses.kjv: As for the Jebusites the inhabitants of Jerusalem, the children of Judah could not drive them out: but the Jebusites dwell with the children of Judah at Jerusalem unto this day.
verses.web: As for the Jebusites, the inhabitants of Jerusalem, the children of Judah couldn’t drive them out; but the Jebusites live with the children of Judah at Jerusalem to this day.
verses.ct: However, the people of Judah were never able to drive out the Jebusites who lived in Jerusalem. So the Jebusites have continued living alongside the people of Judah in Jerusalem to this day.
